0.user_question: In a 1912100-item quiz, 40% of the questions are easy, and the rest are equally divided as average and difficult questions. If Aries is sure to get 75% of the easy questions, and half of the average and difficult questions correctly, how many points is she sure to get?

1.subquestion: How many items represent hard or average questions combined (excluding easy ones)?

subanswer.text: Easy questions account for 40%, leaving us with 100% - 40% = 60%. These 60% are evenly split between average and difficult; therefore, they make up 60% / 2 = 30% together. To accurately assess the number of such non-easy questions proportionally, one needs not just halve but also subtract the portion assigned to 'easy'. Hence taking out 40% first provides the remainder pool where difficulty distribution happens – henceforth addressing both calculations within proper contextual bounds. subanswer.text:
First let’s figure out what percentage isn’t “Easy”. Since we know Easy comprises exactly 40%, this means all other categories share remaining 60%. This amount needs to get split evenly among them so divide it up into three equal parts since you said above ‘the others being equally….’ Here goes: 60 / 3 = 20 meaning every single one makes up precisely 20 % which represents your entire non-“Easy” portion. Therefore; if these percentages relate back directly onto question counts – Multiplying those values by our original item count here would yield results like such :  
*   **Easy** -> (40/100)*1912100 =====>   764840 items  
*   **Average**->(20/100)x1912100 ==>    382420 items      
*   **Hard** -> (20/100)*1912100 ==>     382420 items

subanswer.text: There are a total of 1912100 items, where 40% are easy, therefore the number of easy questions is 1912100 * 0.4 = 764840 questions. Since the remainder is split evenly between average and difficult categories, both would contain an equal share of the leftover percentage which sums up to 100%, thus being assigned \( \frac{1}{2} \) or 60%. Hence, they consist respectively of \( 1912100 \times 0.6 \div 2 = 573630 \) questions per group; henceforth the numbers become accordingly: Easy=764840 , Average = Hard = 573630 . The answer is [Number] Questions Per Group.

0.user_question: In a 1912100-item quiz, 40% of the questions are easy, and the rest are equally divided as average and difficult questions. If Aries is sure to get 75% of the easy questions, and half of the average and difficult questions correctly, how many points is she sure to get?

ost_step.1: Total items are 1912100. Easy questions make up for 40%, so number of easy questions equals 0.4 * 1912100 = 764840.
ost_step.2: Remaining percentage (60%) divides into two equal parts, i.e., easier part makes difficulty level 'average', while other harder one making it at 'difficult'. Therefore each group contains 30% of all items or 0.3*1912100=573630 items respectively.
ost_step.3: Out of this count, we know that if Aries answers every question on first category(which includes easiest ones), then his score would amount to .75*(total item) because only 75 percent gets right; which means from steps above its going to be .75*764840 = 573630 correct responses coming out form easily asked questions. And since both categories together include remaining hardest/intermediate types of problems also but these can not be counted here until mentioned explicitly.
